days.subtopic: Recap: Common Fractions and Equivalent Forms
objectives: Learners should be able to define common fractions (proper, improper, mixed numbers).
Learners should be able to identify the numerator and denominator.
Learners should be able to find equivalent forms of given fractions.
Learners should be able to simplify fractions to their lowest terms.
days.teacher_activity: Teacher begins with a quick recap on types of fractions (proper, improper, mixed numbers), using real-life examples. Explains how to find equivalent fractions by multiplying or dividing the numerator and denominator by the same number. Demonstrates how to simplify fractions to their lowest terms using the greatest common factor (GCF). Provides several examples on the chalkboard and encourages learners to participate in discussions.
days.learner_activity: Learners listen attentively, answer questions posed by the teacher, participate in class discussions, copy examples from the chalkboard, and work out practice questions on finding equivalent fractions and simplifying fractions.
days.assignment: Textbook Exercise 1.1 (Questions 1-5 on finding equivalent fractions and simplifying).

objectives: Learners should be able to identify fractions with different denominators.
Learners should be able to find the least common multiple (LCM) of denominators.
Learners should be able to convert fractions to equivalent fractions with a common denominator.
Learners should be able to add fractions with different denominators.
days.teacher_activity: Teacher reviews finding equivalent fractions from the previous lesson. Introduces the concept of adding fractions with different denominators. Explains the crucial step of finding the Least Common Multiple (LCM) of the denominators to create a common denominator. Demonstrates the step-by-step process: (1) Find LCM, (2) Convert fractions to equivalent fractions with the LCM as the denominator, (3) Add the numerators, (4) Simplify the answer if possible. Works through 2-3 detailed examples on the chalkboard, involving proper and improper fractions.
days.learner_activity: Learners pay close attention to the teacher's explanation and demonstrations. They actively participate by suggesting LCMs and equivalent fractions. Learners copy the examples into their notebooks and attempt practice problems under the teacher's guidance.
days.assignment: Textbook Exercise 1.2 (Questions 1-6 on adding fractions with different denominators).

days.subtopic: Subtracting Fractions with Different Denominators & Introduction to Real-life Problems
objectives: Learners should be able to subtract fractions with different denominators.
Learners should be able to apply addition and subtraction of fractions to solve simple real-life problems.
days.teacher_activity: Teacher begins by reviewing the addition of fractions with different denominators. Introduces subtraction of fractions, highlighting that the process is similar to addition (finding LCM, converting to equivalent fractions, then subtracting numerators). Demonstrates 2-3 examples of subtraction on the chalkboard. Then, introduces simple real-life word problems involving both addition and subtraction of fractions. Guides learners on how to interpret the problems, identify the operation required, and solve them systematically. Emphasises showing all working steps.
days.learner_activity: Learners participate in the review and actively engage with the new concept of subtracting fractions. They work through examples, asking clarifying questions. Learners attempt to solve real-life word problems, sharing their strategies and solutions with the class. They ensure neatness and clear presentation of their working.
days.assignment: Textbook Exercise 1.3 (Questions 1-5 on subtraction of fractions) and two simple word problems from the textbook involving addition/subtraction of fractions.
